ranked_diseases.explanation: Multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling are hallmark features of NF1. The combination of these two features in a pediatric patient is highly suggestive of this diagnosis.
Also presents with multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling, but is less common than NF1. Caused by SPRED1 mutations and lacks neurofibromas.
Can present with cafe-au-lait spots, though typically larger and more irregular with jagged borders. Freckling is less common in this condition.
Previously known as LEOPARD syndrome, can present with multiple lentigines that may resemble freckling and cafe-au-lait spots, though other features are usually present.
Can present with cafe-au-lait spots and skin pigmentation abnormalities, but typically includes early-onset malignancies and other features.
While primarily characterized by white patches, some patients may have hyperpigmented areas that could be mistaken for cafe-au-lait spots, though freckling is not typical.
